intro: Schefflera panayensis, commonly known as the Panay umbrella tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
